basics.name: Luis Herrera C
basics.label: FrontEnd Developer
summary: + 4 years of experience as an Industrial Engineer specialized in purchasing. Currently, I am a Frontend Developer with skills in frameworks, responsive design, API creation and consumption, code testing, and version control.

My previous experience has provided me with transferable skills to web development, such as process optimization, problem-solving, and project management. I am eager to apply my technical knowledge and experience in a web development environment, contributing with innovative and efficient solutions.

certificates.name: React: From Zero to Expert (Hooks and MERN)
React.js with Vite.js and TailwindCSS Course

projects.name: Calendar
projects.description: Create events, check and update your schedule, be more productive.

ideasPlanning.inspiration: Based on apps like Google Calendar
mainFunctions: Create, edit, and delete calendar events
View created events in an agenda format

implementationFunctionalities: Responsive design with Bootstrap and react-big-calendar library for calendar design
testingDeployment: Unit and integration tests with Jest and React Testing Library
Frontend deployment on Vercel and Backend with Render

lessonsImprovements.lessonsLearned: Better state management and experience with continuous deployment

projects.conclusion: The Calendar project has improved my skills with React and Redux, allowing me to efficiently manage the global state of my applications. Additionally, it has enhanced my approach to generating authentications with the help of JWTs.

projects.name: Viva Color
projects.description: Generate color palettes ideal for your websites

ideasPlanning.inspiration: Based on apps like Amazon Prime Video
mainFunctions: Page with main movies and series
View trailers and a brief description of movies and series

implementationFunctionalities: API requests handled with native fetch
Page management with React Router Dom
testingDeployment: Unit and integration tests with Jest and React Testing Library

lessonsImprovements.lessonsLearned: Better management of React Router usage
futureImprovements: Implement movie classification by filtering on the home page

projects.conclusion: The Viva Color project has improved my skills with React and React-router-dom. The implementation of a custom skeleton with TailwindCSS has enhanced my UI design skills.

projects.name: PopCorn Film
projects.description: Search for trailers of your favorite movies and series. Built with information obtained from the TMDB API

ideasPlanning.inspiration: Based on apps like Amazon Prime Video
mainFunctions: Page with main movies and series
View trailers and a brief description of movies and series

implementationFunctionalities: API requests handled with native fetch
Page management with React Router Dom

lessonsImprovements.lessonsLearned: Better management of React Router usage
futureImprovements: Implement movie classification by filtering on the home page

projects.conclusion: The Popcorn project has improved my skills with React and React-router-dom. The implementation of a custom skeleton with TailwindCSS has enhanced my UI design skills.

projects.name: Translator
projects.description: You can translate into different languages with this APP. Translation is achieved by consuming the Deepl API.

ideasPlanning.inspiration: Based on the design of Google Translate.
mainFunctions: Real-time translation of written text to a selected language.
Automatically detect the language in which the message is written.
Use of debounce to reduce the number of API calls.

futureImprovements: Implement more languages and document translation.

projects.conclusion: The Translator app project allowed me to learn how to optimize API requests using debounce. Additionally, I learned to implement dark mode in Tailwind CSS.
